protocol_name: Preparation and Genetic Transformation of Parastagonospora nodorum Protoplasts
protocol_name_html: Preparation and Genetic Transformation of Parastagonospora nodorum Protoplasts

components.data:
Day 1 – Overnight culture

 

Prepare an overnight culture of S. nodorum by inoculation of 100 mL CzV8CS liquid medium (250 mL flask) with a concentrated spore suspension (~108 spores). Incubate culture at 22ºC with shaking (140 rpm). Start culture after lunch on Day 1 to ensure a good yield of mycelium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Day 1 – Overnight culture

 

Prepare an overnight culture of S. nodorum by inoculation of 100 mL CzV8CS liquid medium (250 mL flask) with a concentrated spore suspension (~108 spores). Incubate culture at 22ºC with shaking (140 rpm). Start culture after lunch on Day 1 to ensure a good yield of mycelium.

prepare 100 mL per 250 mL flask for each overnight culture

for     

CZV8CS - liquid media for flask culture

prepare 100 mL per 250 mL flask for each overnight culture for

                                                   100 mL:                                300 mL

Czapek-Dox liquid medium         4.54 g                                  13.62 g        

centrifuged V8 juice                    20 mL                                   60 mL

add H20 to                                  95 mL                                   285 mL

        
adjust to pH 6.0 transfer to

transfer to flask(s) and autoclave

add 5 mL sterile complete supplement to media after autoclaving

 

Complete Supplement (CS)

Bacto-casamino acids     20 g/l

Bacto-peptone                 20 g/l

Bacto-yeast extract         20g/l

Adenine                           3 g/l 9

components.data: Prepare CzV8Cs plates (at least 6 are required per transformation)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare CzV8Cs plates (at least 6 are required per transformation)

CZV8-proto agar 

                                         500 mL                                        300 mL

Czapek-Dox broth              22.7 g                                         13.62 g

agar                                   5 g                                              3 g

sorbitol                              91.1 g                                         54.7 g                       

centrifuged V8 juice         100 mL                                        60 mL

add H2O to                       500 mL                                       300 mL

adjust to pH 6.0 with NaOH

autoclave and pour thin plates (approx. 10mL)

components.data:
Prepare the following solutions:

 

Stock solutions (do not filter sterilise)

 

A. 50 mL 1.2 M MgSO4.7H2O (14.8 g / 50mL)

 

B. 20 mL 1.2M Sorbitol (4.32 g / 20 mL)

 

C. 1 M Tris pH 7.5 2

 

D. 1 mL 1M CaCl2 (0.147 g / mL) 3

 

 

  1. Wash solution 600 mM MgSO4       

50 mL (~50 mL required per prep)

Add 25 mL Soln A to 25 mL milliQ water. Filter sterilise into sterile 50 ml tube.

 

  1. Glucanex solution 1.2 M MgSO4, 10 mM phosphate buffer pH 5.8

25 mL per prep

Add 0.04g NaH2PO4 to 20 mL soln A and adjust pH to 5.8 using NaOH. Add the NaOH drop by drop. A precipitate will form after each drop but will go back into solution after a couple of minutes stirring. What until precipitate has dissolved before recording pH and re-adjusting if required. Once pH is correct, make up volume to 25 mL with remaining soln A. Do not filter sterilise at this point.

 

On the morning of the transformation, add 0.375 g glucanex to the solution and shake well to resuspend. The solution can now be filter sterilised.

 

  1. Protoplast overlay solution 600 mM Sorbitol, 10 Tris pH 7.5

5 mL per prep

Add 2.5 mL of soln B to 2.45 mL milliQ water and 50 ul soln C. Filter sterilise.

 

  1. 1 M Sorbitol-tris solution 2          1 M Sorbitol, 10 Tris pH 7.5

5 mL per prep

Add 4.17 mL soln B to 780 ul milliQ water and 50 uL soln C. Filter sterilse.

 

  1. STC buffer 2,3 1.2 M Sorbitol, 10 mM CaCl2, 10 Tris pH 7.5

10 mL (~10 mL required per prep)

Add 9.8 mL soln B to 100 uL soln C and 100 uL soln D. Filter sterilise

 

  1. 60% PEG solution 2,3 60% PEG-4000, 10 mM CaCl2, 10 Tris pH 7.5

 (5 mL generally enough for 3 preps)

Add 6 g PEG 4000 (BDH only) to 5.3 mL milliQ water, 100 ul soln C and 100 uL soln D. Filter sterilise. Note that 1.2 mL is required for each transformation and thus all 10 mL is not likely to be needed.
components.name: Description

Prepare the following solutions:

 

Stock solutions (do not filter sterilise)

 

A. 50 mL 1.2 M MgSO4.7H2O (14.8 g / 50mL)

 

B. 20 mL 1.2M Sorbitol (4.32 g / 20 mL)

 

C. 1 M Tris pH 7.5 2

 

D. 1 mL 1M CaCl2 (0.147 g / mL) 3

 

 

  1. Wash solution 600 mM MgSO4       

50 mL (~50 mL required per prep)

Add 25 mL Soln A to 25 mL milliQ water. Filter sterilise into sterile 50 ml tube.

 

  1. Glucanex solution 1.2 M MgSO4, 10 mM phosphate buffer pH 5.8

25 mL per prep

Add 0.04g NaH2PO4 to 20 mL soln A and adjust pH to 5.8 using NaOH. Add the NaOH drop by drop. A precipitate will form after each drop but will go back into solution after a couple of minutes stirring. What until precipitate has dissolved before recording pH and re-adjusting if required. Once pH is correct, make up volume to 25 mL with remaining soln A. Do not filter sterilise at this point.

 

On the morning of the transformation, add 0.375 g glucanex to the solution and shake well to resuspend. The solution can now be filter sterilised.

 

  1. Protoplast overlay solution 600 mM Sorbitol, 10 Tris pH 7.5

5 mL per prep

Add 2.5 mL of soln B to 2.45 mL milliQ water and 50 ul soln C. Filter sterilise.

 

  1. 1 M Sorbitol-tris solution 2          1 M Sorbitol, 10 Tris pH 7.5

5 mL per prep

Add 4.17 mL soln B to 780 ul milliQ water and 50 uL soln C. Filter sterilse.

 

  1. STC buffer 2,3 1.2 M Sorbitol, 10 mM CaCl2, 10 Tris pH 7.5

10 mL (~10 mL required per prep)

Add 9.8 mL soln B to 100 uL soln C and 100 uL soln D. Filter sterilise

 

  1. 60% PEG solution 2,3 60% PEG-4000, 10 mM CaCl2, 10 Tris pH 7.5

 (5 mL generally enough for 3 preps)

Add 6 g PEG 4000 (BDH only) to 5.3 mL milliQ water, 100 ul soln C and 100 uL soln D. Filter sterilise. Note that 1.2 mL is required for each transformation and thus all 10 mL is not likely to be needed.

components.data:
Day 2 – Protoplast preparation

 

  1. Harvest mycelium by centrifugation in sterile 50 mL tubes (4kg/5 min/4ºC) using a benchtop centrifuge with a swing-out rotor. During this time, add glucanex to Glucanex solution and also place a Petri dish in the 28oC incubator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Day 2 – Protoplast preparation

 

  1. Harvest mycelium by centrifugation in sterile 50 mL tubes (4kg/5 min/4ºC) using a benchtop centrifuge with a swing-out rotor. During this time, add glucanex to Glucanex solution and also place a Petri dish in the 28oC incubator.

components.data: 1. Remove supernatant and wash mycelium with ~ 50 mL filter-sterile 600 mM MgSO4. Centrifuge as above for 5 min. Filter sterilise glucanex solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Remove supernatant and wash mycelium with ~ 50 mL filter-sterile 600 mM MgSO4. Centrifuge as above for 5 min. Filter sterilise glucanex solution.

components.data: 1. Remove supernatant and resuspend mycelium in one 50 mL tube, with 25 mL filter-sterile glucanex solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Remove supernatant and resuspend mycelium in one 50 mL tube, with 25 mL filter-sterile glucanex solution.

components.data: 1. Incubate for 2h without agitation at 28ºC in a sterile Petri dish. During this stage, melt the top agar and allow to cool in 50oC waterbath (the correct temperature is important).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Incubate for 2h without agitation at 28ºC in a sterile Petri dish. During this stage, melt the top agar and allow to cool in 50oC waterbath (the correct temperature is important).

source_data.protocol_name: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation
source_data.protocol_name_html: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation
source_data.description:
CZV8-top agar 

                                            100 mL per transformation                                     200 mL

Czapek-Dox liquid                4.54 g                                                                     9.08 g

agar                                      0.75 g                                                                     1.5 g

sorbitol                                 18.22 g                                                                   36.44 g

centrifuged V8 juice             20 mL                                                                     40 mL

add H2O to                          100 mL                                                                    200 mL

 

adjust to pH 6.0 with NaOH           

split batch in 2  (½ for plating protoplasts, ½ for overlay)

autoclave

versions.protocol_name: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation
versions.protocol_name_html: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation

components.data: 1. Transfer protoplasts to a 50 mL sterile tube by gently pouring. DO NOT PIPETTE. Then very gently overlay with 5 mL 600 mM sorbitol, 10 mM Tris, pH 7.5. Centrifuge at 4,000 g for 15 min at 4 ºC (benchtop centrifuge).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Transfer protoplasts to a 50 mL sterile tube by gently pouring. DO NOT PIPETTE. Then very gently overlay with 5 mL 600 mM sorbitol, 10 mM Tris, pH 7.5. Centrifuge at 4,000 g for 15 min at 4 ºC (benchtop centrifuge).

components.data: 1. Carefully remove protoplasts from the interface, using a 1 mL pipet, to a sterile 10 mL tube and add an equal volume of 1 M sorbitol, 10 mM Tris, pH 7.5. Mix gently and centrifuge at 1,500 g for 5 min at 4ºC (benchtop centrifuge).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Carefully remove protoplasts from the interface, using a 1 mL pipet, to a sterile 10 mL tube and add an equal volume of 1 M sorbitol, 10 mM Tris, pH 7.5. Mix gently and centrifuge at 1,500 g for 5 min at 4ºC (benchtop centrifuge).

components.data: 1. Wash protoplasts with 3 mL STC buffer (1,500 g/5 min/4ºC) and resuspend in 0.5 mL STC buffer. Use inversion to resuspend protoplasts and place on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Wash protoplasts with 3 mL STC buffer (1,500 g/5 min/4ºC) and resuspend in 0.5 mL STC buffer. Use inversion to resuspend protoplasts and place on ice.

components.data: 1. Typically the protoplasts are counted (either 1:100 or 1:250 dilutions in STC) and then diluted to 5×108 / mL. 100 mL of these are then used for subsequent transformations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Typically the protoplasts are counted (either 1:100 or 1:250 dilutions in STC) and then diluted to 5×108 / mL. 100 mL of these are then used for subsequent transformations.

components.data:
Protoplast transformation

 

1.       Add prepared DNA (3 ug for PCR product or 7.5 ug for linearised construct in a volume up to 125 uL in STC) to 100 uL protoplasts in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. Mix protoplasts with DNA very gently by inversion. Incubate at room temperature for 15 min. Also prepare a control where and equal volume of STC buffer (not containing DNA) is added.

 

During this stage, the pre-warmed top agar can be dispensed in 5 mL aliquots into sterile 10 mL tubes and kept at 50oC. 4 tubes will be needed for each transformation and 2 for each control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Protoplast transformation

 

1.       Add prepared DNA (3 ug for PCR product or 7.5 ug for linearised construct in a volume up to 125 uL in STC) to 100 uL protoplasts in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. Mix protoplasts with DNA very gently by inversion. Incubate at room temperature for 15 min. Also prepare a control where and equal volume of STC buffer (not containing DNA) is added.

 

During this stage, the pre-warmed top agar can be dispensed in 5 mL aliquots into sterile 10 mL tubes and kept at 50oC. 4 tubes will be needed for each transformation and 2 for each control.

versions.protocol_name: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation
versions.protocol_name_html: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation

components.data: 1. Add 200 ul 60% PEG solution to the protoplasts and mix by inversion. Add a further 200 ul 60% PEG solution and a final 800 ul 60% PEG solution with mixing by inversion and gentle agitation after each addition. Incubate at room temperature for 15-20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Add 200 ul 60% PEG solution to the protoplasts and mix by inversion. Add a further 200 ul 60% PEG solution and a final 800 ul 60% PEG solution with mixing by inversion and gentle agitation after each addition. Incubate at room temperature for 15-20 min.

components.data: 1. Transfer approximately a quarter of the transformation mix (normally around 300-350 uL) to 10 mL pre-warmed (50oC) CzV8-top agar, mix and on to a CzV8 plates (pre-warmed to RT). Repeat for remaining transformation mix (should have poured 4 plates in total). Repeat for 2 plates using the control (no DNA) transformation. Incubate plates in the dark (wrap plates in aluminium foil) at 22ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Transfer approximately a quarter of the transformation mix (normally around 300-350 uL) to 10 mL pre-warmed (50oC) CzV8-top agar, mix and on to a CzV8 plates (pre-warmed to RT). Repeat for remaining transformation mix (should have poured 4 plates in total). Repeat for 2 plates using the control (no DNA) transformation. Incubate plates in the dark (wrap plates in aluminium foil) at 22ºC.

components.data:
Antibiotic overlay   (~40 h after transformation for hyg, 24 h for phleo)

 

  1. Melt second bottle of CzV8-top agar and cool to 50ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Antibiotic overlay   (~40 h after transformation for hyg, 24 h for phleo)

 

  1. Melt second bottle of CzV8-top agar and cool to 50ºC.

versions.protocol_name: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation
versions.protocol_name_html: CZV8CS- top agar for fungal protoplast transformation

components.data:
1. Add the appropriate amount (see below) of antibiotic to 60 mL CzV8-top agar and pour 10 mL over each of the transformed protoplast plates. Pour 10 mL over one of the control protoplast plates and leave the other control plate without antibiotic overlay.

    Antibiotic amount

     

     Stock solutions

             Phleomycin (Cayla) 250 mg/mL

             Hygromycin (Astral)          100 mg/mL

     

    Required amount for S. nodorum (total concentration for the whole plate)

             Phleo           50 ug/mL

             Hyg             200 ug/mL

     

    Plate agar volume             10 mL

    Protoplast top agar volume  10 mL

    Antibiotic overlay volume    10 mL

    Total                                       30 mL

     

    Prepare antibiotic overlay agar at 3x concentration required for the whole plate.

     

    3x Phleo = 250 mg/mL        i.e. 0.6 ul/ml of overlay (0.6 x 60 = 36ul)

    3x Hyg = 100 mg/mL        i.e. 6 ul/ml of overlay (6 x 60 = 360ul)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Add the appropriate amount (see below) of antibiotic to 60 mL CzV8-top agar and pour 10 mL over each of the transformed protoplast plates. Pour 10 mL over one of the control protoplast plates and leave the other control plate without antibiotic overlay.

    Antibiotic amount

     

     Stock solutions

             Phleomycin (Cayla) 250 mg/mL

             Hygromycin (Astral)          100 mg/mL

     

    Required amount for S. nodorum (total concentration for the whole plate)

             Phleo           50 ug/mL

             Hyg             200 ug/mL

     

    Plate agar volume             10 mL

    Protoplast top agar volume  10 mL

    Antibiotic overlay volume    10 mL

    Total                                       30 mL

     

    Prepare antibiotic overlay agar at 3x concentration required for the whole plate.

     

    3x Phleo = 250 mg/mL        i.e. 0.6 ul/ml of overlay (0.6 x 60 = 36ul)

    3x Hyg = 100 mg/mL        i.e. 6 ul/ml of overlay (6 x 60 = 360ul)

components.data: 1. Wrap plates in foil and wait until mycelium appears on the surface of the transformed protoplast plates. Growth should appear on the control plate without overlay in a day or so and there should be no growth on the control plate with antibiotic overlay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Wrap plates in foil and wait until mycelium appears on the surface of the transformed protoplast plates. Growth should appear on the control plate without overlay in a day or so and there should be no growth on the control plate with antibiotic overlay.

components.data: 1. Sub-culture colonies as they appear – between one and three weeks.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 1. Sub-culture colonies as they appear – between one and three weeks.
